com.opengamma.strata.engine

Interface CalculationEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCalculationEngine

    public interface CalculationEngine
    The calculation engine is the main entry point for performing calculations.

    The engine calculates values of measures for a set of calculation targets, often trades.

    The output of a calculation is a grid of results with a row for each target and a column for each measure.

    In order to perform calculations, a user must provide the following information:

    • The targets for which the calculations should be performed, often trades
    • The measures which should be calculated
    • Rules defining how the calculations should be performed and what market data should be used
    • The market data
    Providing the market data is optional. The engine will attempt to provide any data that is required by the calculations but not provided by the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Results calculate(List<? extends CalculationTarget> targets, List<Column> columns, CalculationRules calculationRules, BaseMarketData marketData)
      Calculates values of measures for a set of targets.

      Calculates values of measures for a set of targets over multiple scenarios.

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        Results calculate(List<? extends CalculationTarget> targets,
                  List<Column> columns,
                  CalculationRules calculationRules,
                  BaseMarketData marketData)
        Calculates values of measures for a set of targets.

        The output of the calculations is a grid of results with a row for each target and a column for each measure.

        The calculation rules specify how the calculations should be performed. This includes the model and model parameters, the market data that should be used, and the reporting currency of the results.

        The column arguments specify what measure the column contains and also specifies any rule overrides that apply to the column.

        Parameters:
        targets - the targets for which values of the measures will be calculated, often trades
        columns - the configuration for the columns that will be calculated, including the measure and any column-specific overrides
        calculationRules - the rules defining how the calculations are performed, what market data should be used for each calculation and how the results should be reported
        marketData - the market data used in the calculations. If the calculations require data that is not provided in this set, the engine will attempts to provide the missing data
        Returns:
        the results of the calculations

      • calculate

        Results calculate(List<? extends CalculationTarget> targets,
                  List<Column> columns,
                  CalculationRules calculationRules,
                  BaseMarketData baseMarketData,
                  ScenarioDefinition scenarioDefinition)
        Calculates values of measures for a set of targets over multiple scenarios. Multiple values are calculated for each measure, one for each scenario.

        The output of the calculations is a grid of results with a row for each target and a column for each measure. Each cell contains the results for all scenarios, normally as a vector or array, or possibly an aggregate value.

        The calculation rules specify how the calculations should be performed. This includes the model and model parameters, the market data that should be used, and the reporting currency of the results.

        The column arguments specify what measure the column contains and also specifies any rule overrides that apply to the column.

        The scenario data is derived by applying the scenario definition to the base market data to produce a set of market data for each scenario.

        Parameters:
        targets - the targets for which values of the measures will be calculated, often trades
        columns - the configuration for the columns that will be calculated, including the measure and any column-specific overrides
        calculationRules - the rules defining how the calculations are performed, what market data should be used for each calculation and how the results should be reported
        baseMarketData - the market data used in the calculations. If the calculations require data that is not provided in this set, the engine will attempts to provide the missing data
        scenarioDefinition - defines how the market data for each scenario is derived from the base data
        Returns:
        the results of the calculations
